screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .vectornator file in Linearity Vectornator
screenshot.caption: VECTORNATOR file open in Linearity Vectornator

description: Graphic designers primarily use Linearity Vectornator to design icons, logos, GUI mockups, print designs, digital typography, and other vector illustrations. When a user saves a drawing in Vectornator, the application creates a VECTORNATOR file to store the illustration.
NOTE: Vectornator is now known as Curve, which saves users' drawings as .CURVE files. While VECTORNATOR files and CURVE files use different file extensions, they use the same file format.

images.alt: Screenshot of a .vectornator file in Linearity Vectornator
images.caption: VECTORNATOR file open in Linearity Vectornator
